detail: Policy Exchange Bangladesh, an economic think-tank in Dhaka, together with Chatham House (UK) and under the UNIDO-led SWITCH to Circular Value Chains project (SWITCH2CE), organized a workshop titled “Advancing Circular Textile Policies in Bangladesh” on November 5, 2023. The SWITCH to Circular Economy Value Chains project (SWITCH2CE) is co-funded by the European Union and the Government of Finland. The event brought together participants from the public and private sectors who shared valuable insights, ideas, an recommendations on enhancing the circularity of the economy. Check out the media coverage below for more details.

title: SheSTEM: Advancing Women in STEM supported by the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands
subTitle: Policy Exchange Bangladesh is pleased to be involved in the innovative project “SheSTEM: Career Knows No Gender,” which is being supported by the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands
detail: Policy Exchange Bangladesh is pleased to be involved in the innovative project “SheSTEM: Career Knows No Gender,” which is being supported by the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands. This multi-year program is driven by 10 Minute School, a2i, LightCastle Partners, DevLearn and Policy Exchange Bangladesh to change the landscape of female participation in STEM fields (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics). Despite the different roles of the consortium members, the combined effort is to break gender barriers in STEM related employment in the country. To achieve that goal, Policy Exchange Bangladesh will actively contribute in providing technical assistance and in raising awareness of Bangladesh Public Service Commission (BPSC) by sensitizing and by improving the knowledge in the global best practices, establishing a gender friendly screening tool which will eventually help in fair evaluation. The ultimate goal is to increase awareness and adoption of gender neutral strategies within BPSC, fostering an environment that actively encourages female employment in public institutions. Simultaneously, Policy Exchange Bangladesh will raise awareness and sensitize the officials of the Ministry of Public Administration (MOPA) and then incentivize so that the inclusion of female participation in STEM roles within public institutions become visible.

title: Procurement Manager’s Index (PMI): Insightful Discussions at Policy Exchange-MCCI Forum
subTitle: On November 7, 2023, the Metropolitan Chamber of Commerce and Industry, Dhaka (MCCI), in partnership with the Policy Exchange of Bangladesh (PEB) and supported by the Foreign, Commonwealth & Development
detail: On November 7, 2023, the Metropolitan Chamber of Commerce and Industry, Dhaka (MCCI), in partnership with the Policy Exchange of Bangladesh (PEB) and supported by the Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office (FCDO), organized a Focus Group Discussion on the “Procurement Manager’s Index (PMI) of Bangladesh” at its Gulshan office. The event witnessed participation from representatives of MCCI, PEB, FCDO, and MCCI member firms. Dr. M. Masrur Reaz, Chairman & CEO of PEB, adeptly moderated the discussion, fostering valuable insights and constructive discourse.

title: Empowering Women Workers: Unveiling Strategies for a Sustainable Apparel Sector
subTitle: Policy Exchange Bangladesh, in collaboration with LightCastle Partners, hosted a Learning Dissemination and Roundtable Discussion on November 4th, 2023.
detail: Policy Exchange Bangladesh, in collaboration with LightCastle Partners, hosted a Learning Dissemination and Roundtable Discussion on November 4th, 2023. The event unveiled the findings of the comprehensive study titled “Threads of Progress: A Comprehensive Landscape Study of the Apparel Industry and the Future for Women Workers,” was conducted as part of the Bunon 2030 initiative, under the Oporajita project, supported by H&M Foundation and managed by The Asia Foundation. The study emphasized the need for sustainable growth, addressing challenges posed by automation, circularity, and global dynamics. Policy recommendations were presented to fortify the industry against future shocks while ensuring the well-being of garment workers. The event facilitated insightful discussions with industry leaders, academics, and development partners, highlighting key strategies for a resilient future.

title: High-Level Breakfast Meeting Explores Bangladesh-UK Collaboration for Future Growth
subTitle: Policy Exchange Bangladesh and the British High Commission Dhaka jointly arranged a breakfast meeting last week featuring Professor Adnan Khan, the Chief Economist of the UK’s Foreign, Commonwealth
detail: Policy Exchange Bangladesh and the British High Commission Dhaka jointly arranged a breakfast meeting last week featuring Professor Adnan Khan, the Chief Economist of the UK’s Foreign, Commonwealth, and Development Office (FCDO). This event brought together prominent entrepreneurs from Bangladesh’s private sector for discussion on critical factors for Bangladesh’s future growth, including long-term finance, exports, economic diversification, and the digital economy. The participants also explored opportunities for collaboration between Bangladesh and the UK in these key areas.
